thread.title: NHL roundup: Isles drop debut in Brooklyn - Hockey
thread.title_full: NHL roundup: Isles drop debut in Brooklyn - Hockey - NorthJersey.com

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS |
title: NHL roundup: Isles drop debut in Brooklyn - Hockey
text:
The Islanders’ first game at Barclays Center in Brooklyn was spoiled when the Blackhawks’ Jonathan Toews scored on a power play at 1:49 of overtime to give Chicago a 3-2 victory Friday night.
With the Blackhawks awarded an extra skater after a slashing penalty on the Islanders’ Nick Leddy during the 3-on-3 overtime, Patrick Kane sent the puck toward the middle of the net from the right side and Toews tapped it in while fighting off a defender.
Kane and Artem Anisimov also scored for the Blackhawks and goalie Corey Crawford stopped 34 shots.
Crawford improved to 4-0-1 in his career against the Islanders and helped the defending Stanley Cup champions bounce back after losing their season opener at home to the Rangers two nights earlier.
John Tavares and Marek Zidlicky scored for the Islanders. Thomas Greiss, starting in place of the injured Jaroslav Halak, finished with 32 saves. 
RED WINGS 4, MAPLE LEAFS 0 (at Detroit) — Justin Abdelkader had a hat trick and Dylan Larkin scored in his NHL debut, helping Detroit beat the Mike Babcock-led Leafs.
Jimmy Howard stopped 21 shots for his 21st career shutout for the Red Wings, who won their season-opening game and dropped Toronto to 0-2 with its $50 million coach.
The Maple Leafs lured Babcock away from Detroit with an eight-year contract that more than doubled what any other NHL coach is making per season.
Abdelkader scored twice in the first and completed the hart trick at 3:54 of the second.
KINGS SETTLE: Center Mike Richards and the Los Angeles Kings settled their dispute Friday over the termination of Richards’ contract after his arrest in June. 
The NHL Players’ Association announced the settlement without disclosing the terms.
